---
title: Quick Start
description: 'Get started with Dakora in 5 minutes'
---

## Installation

<CodeGroup>

```bash pip
pip install dakora
```

```bash uv
uv add dakora
```

</CodeGroup>

<Info>
  For the interactive playground, PyPI releases include a pre-built UI. For development installs (git clone), Node.js 18+ is required.
</Info>

## Initialize a Project

Create a new Dakora project:

```bash
dakora init
```

This creates:
- `dakora.yaml` - Configuration file
- `prompts/` - Directory for template files
- `prompts/summarizer.yaml` - Example template

## Create Your First Template

Create `prompts/greeting.yaml`:

```yaml
id: greeting
version: 1.0.0
description: A personalized greeting template
template: |
  Hello {{ name }}!
  {% if age %}You are {{ age }} years old.{% endif %}
  {{ message | default("Have a great day!") }}
inputs:
  name:
    type: string
    required: true
  age:
    type: number
    required: false
  message:
    type: string
    required: false
    default: "Welcome to Dakora!"
```

## Use in Python

### Basic Rendering

```python
from dakora import Vault

# Initialize vault
vault = Vault("dakora.yaml")

# Get and render template
template = vault.get("greeting")
result = template.render(name="Alice", age=25)

print(result)
```

**Output:**
```
Hello Alice!
You are 25 years old.
Welcome to Dakora!
```

### Execute with LLMs

<Warning>
  You need an API key to execute templates with LLM providers. See [API Keys Guide](/guides/api-keys) for setup.
</Warning>

```python
from dakora import Vault

vault = Vault("dakora.yaml")
template = vault.get("summarizer")

# Execute with GPT-4
result = template.execute(
    model="gpt-4",
    input_text="Your article content here..."
)

print(result.output)
print(f"Cost: ${result.cost_usd:.4f}")
print(f"Tokens: {result.tokens_in} ‚Üí {result.tokens_out}")
```

## Interactive Playground

### Try Online

Visit **[playground.dakora.io](https://playground.dakora.io)** to try Dakora instantly in your browser.

### Or Run Locally

Launch the web playground (included with pip install):

```bash
dakora playground
```

This automatically:
- üî® Builds the React UI (first run only)
- üöÄ Starts server at `http://localhost:3000`
- üåê Opens your browser

<Tip>
  The online and local playground are identical. Use the online version for quick testing, and local for development.
</Tip>

**Options:**
```bash
dakora playground --port 8080      # Custom port
dakora playground --no-browser     # Don't open browser
dakora playground --demo           # Demo mode (read-only)
```

## CLI Usage

### List Templates

```bash
dakora list
```

### Get Template Content

```bash
dakora get greeting
```

### Execute Template

```bash
dakora run summarizer --model gpt-4 --input-text "Article to summarize..."
```

### Compare Models

Compare outputs across multiple LLM models:

```bash
dakora compare summarizer \
  --models gpt-4,claude-3-opus,gemini-pro \
  --input-text "Article to summarize..."
```

**Output modes:**
- Default: Clean table format with truncated responses
- `--verbose`: Show full responses for each model
- `--json`: Machine-readable JSON output

```bash
# Verbose output with full responses
dakora compare summarizer \
  --models gpt-4,claude-3-opus \
  --input-text "Text..." \
  --verbose

# JSON output for programmatic use
dakora compare summarizer \
  --models gpt-4,claude-3-opus \
  --input-text "Text..." \
  --json
```

### Bump Version

```bash
dakora bump greeting --minor
```
